text:
You don't "need" the extension. Just makes it easy to add a query parameter.

HubSpot caches pages, so you're not going to see the changes instantly. But you can simply add a query parameter i.e. `?blahblahdjejd` to the URL and it will load an uncashed version. You just have to change the career parameter every time you want to reload it.

The developer extension has a button to automatically do this, but it can be done manually

Yeah this is simply not true..

You can simply add a query parameter i.e. `?blahblahdjejd` to the URL and it will load an uncashed version. You just have to change the career parameter every time you want to reload it
yes, you can add &hsCacheBuster=9495 (random 4 digits) but I donâ€™t believe this is a true clear of all caches.
it clears the cache for the load of the page, so technically only for you.
